alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 5:15PM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. Smaller streams and tributaries flowing into the Salt River within Star Valley will continue to run near or above bankfull, and ponding of water in low-lying areas is likely through the weekend and into next week. For the Salt River Basin...including Etna...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Salt River near Etna. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Small creeks and streams that flow through the towns of Freeedom and Fairview are at bankfull. Minor flooding along low lying areas in Freedom and Fariview is occurring. At 5.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Monitor high water along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Small creeks and streams are flooding in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of ranchland/pastureland near Etna. At 5.5 feet, Flood stage. Low land flooding along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Low land flooding becomes more widespread upstream in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of pastureland/ranchland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM MDT Saturday, May 13 the stage was 4.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 5.0 feet Monday morning. It will rise to flood stage of 5.5 feet by Friday evening. - Action stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 500 PM MDT.
